data.title: Sen. Olympia Snowe, R
data.meta_description: The Maine senator, a moderate Republican on the Finance Committee, is in an influential position as the only GOP member so far to vote for reform. She doesn't want a government-sponsored public plan to compete with private insurers but may support it as a fallback option if the private sector doesn't perform adequately.
data.text:
SEN. OLYMPIA SNOWE, R-MAINE

MEMBER, SENATE FINANCE COMMITTEE

Date of Birth: Feb. 21, 1947.

Education: B.A., University of Maine.

Career Path: Snowe served 16 years in the U.S. House before being elected to the Senate in 1994.

Role in Health Care Reform, 1993-1994: None.

Why She’s a Player Now: Sen. Snowe is the only Republican lawmaker thus far to vote yes for a health-overhaul bill. Democrats courting her for months because of her moderate leanings, but an affirmative vote on final legislation is still up in the air. Snowe supports a “public option trigger,” which is not currently in Senate legislation.

Quote: “My vote today is my vote today. It doesn’t forecast what my vote will be tomorrow.” (Oct. 13, 2009)
